channel.title: question on Varun Saini
channel.description: Recent content in question on Varun Saini

item.title: what do you learn from technical videos
item.description: I watch many technical videos but I feel that I don’t learn much from the technical videos. I have tried some techniques but nothing has worked as much as I want. That’s why I thoguht of asking, What and how people learn from technical videos.

item.title: question about type assertion in go
item.description: One of our go app crashed recently because of a bug in https://github.com/urfave/cli/, here is the PR with fix from my collegue who found the issue. Then we started talking about it internally and found something that’s interesting. I understand some of it but not fully so I thought of asking people who might know. My question is why bar works but not foo. package main import ( "fmt" ) func main() { var f interface{} var b interface{} f = foo() b = bar() if _, ok := f.
